declass
  • Reference
  • Articles

    • Query Histocial Records from Columbia University History Lab - Declassification Engine API
  • News

Query documents based on randomly sampled IDs.

This function queries documents by randomly sampled IDs.

declass_query_random_ids_data(limit)

Arguments

limit

The number of randomply sampled IDs.

Value

Content of the documents

Examples

declass_query_random_ids_data(3)
#> $count
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $results
#>   body_summary cable_references classification cable_type topics from_field
#> 1           NA               NA           <NA>  withdrawn     NA     ANKARA
#> 2           NA               NA   CONFIDENTIAL       full     NA    ALGIERS
#> 3           NA               NA   UNCLASSIFIED       full     NA  THE HAGUE
#>                id                       subject category     office
#> 1 1975ANKARA01299                 TRAVEL ORDERS       NA       <NA>
#> 2 1975ALGIER01961                      SECVISIT       NA  ACTION SS
#> 3  1977THEHA03481 DUTCH FIRST CHAMBER ELECTIONS       NA ACTION EUR
#>                           title nuclear            to_field source location
#> 1                 TRAVEL ORDERS      NA                 n/a     NA       NA
#> 2                      SECVISIT      NA STATE USUN NEW YORK     NA       NA
#> 3 DUTCH FIRST CHAMBER ELECTIONS      NA               STATE     NA       NA
#>   type refs
#> 1 <NA>   NA
#> 2   TE   NA
#> 3   TE   NA
#>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     body
#> 1                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   <NA>
#> 2 1. WE READ LAST PARA USUN'S 4021 TO MEAN MEETING BETWEEN\nSECRETARY AND BOUTEFLIKA MAY BE IN THE WORKS. FOLLOWING\nARE SOME POINTS FOR POSSIBLE INCLUSION IN TALKING PAPER\nFOR THAT MEETING.\n2. SECRETARY MIGHT:\nA. PROVIDE WRAP-UP ON MIDDLE EAST SITUATION ASKING\nTHAT IT BE CONVEYED TO BOUMEDIENE, ALONG WITH EXPRESSION OF\nAPPRECIATION FOR BOUMEIDENE'S UNDERSTANDING AND OUR HOPE,\nEXPRESSED IN SECRETARY'S SEPTEMBER 1 LETTER, THAT HE WILL\nHAVE CHANCE MEET WITH BOUMEDIENE TO EXCHANGE VIEWS ON\nMIDDLE EAST AND PRODUCER/CONSUMER RELATIONS.\nB. NOTE BOUTEFLIKA'S EMPHASIS ON COMMON DESTINY OF\nDEVELOPING AND DEVELOPED WORLD AND ON LINKAGE BETWEEN THEIR\nINTERESTS IN HIS 29 AUGUST NONALIGNED CONFERENCE SPEECH AND\nON NEED TO AVOID CONFRONTATION IN HIS OPENING 7TH SPECIAL\nSESSION ADDRESS, AND REAFFIRM US DESIRE TO ENGAGE IN GENUINE\nDIALOGUE TO RESOLVE COMMON PROBLEMS.\nC. REMIND BOUTEFLIKA OF US OPPOSITION TO IDEA OF\nISRAELI SUSPENSION/EXPULSION (THOUGH ALGERIA APPARENTLY\nHAS NOT BEEN IN FOREFRONT OF THOSE PUSHING IT);\nD. EXPRESS APPRECIATION FOR PRESIDENT BOUMEDIENE'S\nAND MINISTER OF INDUSTRY AND ENERGY ABDESSELAM'S HAVING TWICE\nRECEIVED UNDERSECRETARY ROBINSON AT SECRETARY'S REQUEST TO\nDISCUSS ECONOMIC QUESTIONS.\nE. NOTE THAT DESPITE RESUMPTION OF DIPLOMATIC RELATIONS\nLAST NOVEMBER AND PRESENTATION OF CREDENTIALS BY US\nAMBASSADOR IN JANUARY ALGERIA HAS NOT YET NAMED AMBASSADOR\nTO WASHINGTON AND ASK WHEN THEY PLAN TO DO SO.\n3. BOUTEFLIKA'S OPENING 7TH SPECIAL SESSION ADDRESS\n(USUN 3945) AND RAHAL CONVERSATION (USUN 4021) PROVIDE\nPROBABLE ALGERIAN POINTS. RAHAL'S STRESS ON NEED TO\n"STABILIZE PURCHASING POWER" IS THEME BOUMEDIENE HAS\nSOUNDED BOTH WITH ME AND WITH ROBINSON, AND\nONE LIKELY TO SURFACE AGAIN. IN ANY MIDDLE EAST DISCUSSION,\nBOUTEFLIKA ALSO LIKELY TO STRESS NEED TO SATISFY PALESTINIAN\nASPIRATIONS AND TO HAVE MOVEMENT SOON ON GOLAN HEIGHTS ISSUE.\nPARKER\n
#> 3                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               1. ELECTIONS WERE HELD ON JULY 6 FOR HALF OF THE 75\nSEATS IN THE FIRST CHAMBER OF THE DUTCH BI-CAMERAL LEGIS-\nLATURE. FIRST CHAMBER ELECTIONS WERE SOMETHING OF AN\nANTI-CLIMAX, AS ITS MEMBERS WERE CHOSEN BY THE PROVINCIAL\nCOUNCILS FROM EACH OF THE ELEVEN DUTCH PROVINCES WHO\nTHEMSELVES HAD BEEN ELECTED IN 1974.\n2. THE FIRST CHAMBER SHOWED A GAIN OF FOUR SEATS FOR\nTHE LABOR PARTY (PVDA), A GAIN OF THREE SEATS FOR THE\nLIBERAL PARTY (VVD), A LOSS OF FIVE SEATS FOR THE\nCHRISTIAN DEMOCRATS (CDA), AND A LOSS OF ALL THREE SEATS\nFOR D66. THESE RESULTS REFLECT EXACTLY THE RELATIVE\nGAINS AND LOSSES OF THE MAJOR POLITICAL PARTIES DURING\nTHE 1974 PROVINCIAL ELECTIONS.\n3. THE FIRST CHAMBER OF THE DUTCH PARLIAMENT HAS\nSEVERELY LIMITED POWERS; THOSE POWERS THAT EXIST ON\nPAPER, SUCH AS THE RIGHT TO ACT ON ALL LEGISLATION BEFORE\nIT BECOMES LAW, ARE SELDOM EXERCISED. MANY OF THE\nFIRST CHAMBER'S MEMBERS ARE ONCE-PROMINENT POLITICAL\nFIGURES WHO ARE EITHER IN A GRADUAL POLITICAL WANTE OR\nWHO ARE MOMENTARILY OUT OF THE POLITICAL MAINSTREAM.\nTHE FIRST CHAMBER AMY WELL BE FACING THE SAME POLITICAL\nFATE AS BRITAIN'S HOUSE OF LORDS OR EVEN, IF THE PARTY\nPLATFORM OF THE DUTCH LABOR PARTY IS IMPLEMENTED,\nABOLISHED.\nMCCLOSKEY\n
